Location may use sources like GPS, Wi‑Fi, mobile networks, and sensors to help estimate your device’s location. Google may collect location data periodically and use this data in an anonymous way to improve location accuracy and location-based services.

@Module.Name: Evaluate
@Module.Description: This module is an evaluation module, evaluating the selected components of their contribution to fulfilling the user's intent

@Module.Name: Decide
@Module.Description: This module is a decision module, deciding the final action based on the evaluation result, whether complete or wrong or go on

Output.reason: The 'Use location' switch is currently set to 'Off'. To enable earthquake alerts, location services must be active. The user can toggle this switch to 'On' and explore advanced settings to complete the task.

@History_operation: -> Scroll forward on android.widget.ScrollView -> Click on clickable 'android:id/title' Location 'android:id/summary' On - 1 app has access to location -> Click on clickable 'android:id/title' Advanced 'android:id/summary' Emergency Location Service, Google Location Accuracy, Google Location History, Google Location Sharing -> Click on 'com.android.settings:id/switch_bar' clickable 'com.android.settings:id/switch_text' Use location 'com.android.settings:id/switch_widget' clickable On
@Current_Action: Click on 'com.android.settings:id/switch_bar' clickable 'com.android.settings:id/switch_text' Use location 'com.android.settings:id/switch_widget' clickable On
